summary: This is an FBI FD-302 interview report of Steve Scully, a former telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein on his private island from approximately 1999-2005/2006. Scully describes Epstein's operations, the presence of young girls, suspicious activities, and observations of key figures like Ghislaine Maxwell and Prince Andrew. The interview was conducted on August 9, 2019, in St. Thomas, Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Steve Scully
persons.role: Former telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Interviewed by the FBI, worked for Jeffrey Epstein on his private island from approximately 1999-2005/2006, installing internet and phone systems. He provided observations about Epstein's activities, staff, and guests.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as 'a pretty bad guy' and 'an intense man' by Scully. He owned the private island and was concerned with constant phone/internet service. Scully observed pictures of young girls in his bedroom and described his interactions with young girls.

persons.name: Miles Alexander
persons.context: One of two property managers on Epstein's island. Epstein would not allow both managers to leave the island at the same time.

persons.name: Cathy Alexander
persons.context: The other property manager on the island, who hated Epstein. She was disgusted by the many pictures of young girls in Epstein's bedroom.

persons.name: Bosco
persons.context: An engineer often on the island who told Scully that a girl (name redacted) was like Epstein's daughter and did special projects for him. He warned Scully not to ask about her.

persons.name: Alan
persons.context: One of Epstein's attorneys who stayed on the island on one occasion. Scully described him as a 'dick'.

persons.name: Les Wexner
persons.context: Was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, indicating a close connection.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by Scully as a 'gutsy and manipulative woman' who shared an office with Epstein on the island.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Observed by Scully on the island with a bodyguard. Scully recalled him 'grinding against some young girl in the pool'.

connections.description: Scully worked as a telecommunications technician for Epstein on his private island from approximately 1999-2005/2006.
Miles Alexander worked as a property manager on Epstein's island under strict rules set by Epstein.
Cathy Alexander worked as a property manager on Epstein's island and hated him, disgusted by pictures in his bedroom.
Maxwell shared an office with Epstein on the island and is described as a close associate.
Wexner was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, indicating a frequent and prioritized contact.
Prince Andrew was observed as a guest on Epstein's island, with Scully recalling inappropriate behavior.
Alan is identified as one of Epstein's attorneys who stayed on the island.
Bosco worked as an engineer on the island and communicated Epstein's rules to other staff.

events.title: Scully's Employment on Epstein's Island
events.description: Steve Scully worked as a telecommunications technician for Jeffrey Epstein on his private island, visiting approximately 100 times during this period.

events.title: FBI Interview of Steve Scully
events.description: Steve Scully was interviewed by the FBI at the St. Thomas Resident Agency in the Virgin Islands, providing information about his time working for Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Requires Bodyguards to Carry Guns
events.description: After 2001, Epstein required all his personal bodyguards to carry guns, some on ankle holsters.

events.title: Observation of Prince Andrew with Young Girl
events.description: Scully recalled observing Prince Andrew on the island 'grinding against some young girl in the pool'.

events.title: Observation of Naked Girls in Grotto
events.description: Scully recalled seeing three young girls and a man in the 'grotto' area of the island; the girls were naked and did not look 18.

events.title: Scully Quits After Conversation with Pool Guy
events.description: Scully quit his job the day after a pool guy (brought from West Palm Beach) told him 'what's with the young girls' and 'I turned a blind eye', adding it was worse in West Palm Beach.

locations: Epstein's private island (Little St. James, U.S. Virgin Islands)
St. Thomas, Virgin Islands (location of FBI interview)
Florida (location of Epstein home, specifically West Palm Beach mentioned)
South Africa (where property managers Miles and Cathy Alexander may have moved)
keyFacts: Steve Scully, a former telecom technician for Epstein, estimated he visited the private island about 100 times between 1999-2005/2006 and described Epstein as 'a pretty bad guy'.
Scully observed a picture in Epstein's office of a topless girl (name redacted) with two other topless girls, believed to be about 15-16 years old, taken on the island.
Scully recalled seeing Prince Andrew on the island with a bodyguard and remembered him 'grinding against some young girl in the pool'.
Epstein required all his personal bodyguards to carry guns after 2001, some in ankle holsters, indicating heightened security concerns.
Les Wexner was always on speed dial on all of Epstein's phones, highlighting a direct and frequent line of communication.
